post_text:
IMAV Athletics is proud to announce that our Boy's Basketball team has made the playoffs!!!

We want to thank our coaches for stepping up and completing the task/goal given for the year.

They will play on Friday at 5:30 p.m. @ Joy Christian School! We are the 11th seed!!!! Come out and support your Bears!

What we've done in 3 years in the CAA:
Added 9 sports
Have over 300 athletes
Cheer 2nd place trophy
Playoff appearances by...volleyball, football, boys basketball.
Added elementary sports
Entered our dance team into competition.
Football academies.

- Thank you to ALL our athletes that are forever BEARS!

We are proud to be a BEAR and we know YOU are too! #BeABear

Elementary Football begins tomorrow!!!
11/5 from 3:30 p.m. - 5:30p.m.
1st-4th graders. Boys and girls.
Students should change clothes after school and meet us in the hallway in front of Coach G's office.
Your child must bring....
-Mouthpiece
-white t shirt
-black basketball shorts
-athletic shoes/cleats
Physical form

-Parents will be given a parent consent form after practice is complete, please plan and receiving one at the end of the practice! This is the only practice day this week!

shared_text:
Raymond and Nicholas - A Glimpse of Us
September 28, 2018 at 7:48 PM ¬∑

So we are blessed of course that in Little Chute, Wisconsin Raymond is a very accepted boy. But I had to share a quick picture. Raymond was water boying for his homecoming football game and his team won 42 -0 over the Green Bay East Red Devils. Typically we don't end up in the "good game" handshake line but tonight we ended up on the side GB walked out on.

Well one kid looked at Raymond, a good 6-8 feet back from the line and just said guys we missed him. And that's all it took. Some of those boys (a pretty good chunk) doubled back just to wish him a good game and give him first bumps.

I was in awe and could only quick grab one picture on my dying phone.

Class Act GB East Football Team. Thank you for helping cap off a great night for my guy. Even in the midst of disappointment. The world could learn a thing or 2 from you.

So we are blessed of course that in Little Chute, Wisconsin Raymond is a very accepted boy. But I had to share a quick picture. Typically we don't end up in the "good game" handshake line but tonight we ended up on the side GB walked out on.

Well one kid looked at Raymond, a good 6-8 feet back from the line and just said guys we missed him. And that's all it took. Some of those boys (a pretty good chunk) doubled back just to wish him a good game and give him first bumps.

I was in awe and could only quick grab one picture on my dying phone.

Class Act GB East Football Team. Thank you for helping cap off a great night for my guy. Even in the midst of disappointment. The world could learn a thing or 2 from you.

post_text:
We want to say thank you to all of our Athletic Department families!! Your donations, time, efforts, and love are the secret weapons that make our program go!! We will never cease to say thank you, nor will we stop trying to provide the best for your children! Thank you!

- Imagine Avondale Athletic Department

post_text:
Football tryouts start tomorrow!! 8/3 From 3:30 p.m. - 5:30 p.m. We are excited for this year's football season!!

What you need: white shirt, black basketball shorts, football cleats or tennis shoes and water.

Parents: please be on time at 5:30 to pick up your child!

Results: we will announce the team at the end of the last day of tryouts on Tuesday August 7th!

Best of luck everyone!!!
#BeABear
